did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Prince William County Historic Newspapers Collection

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Libraries. Special Collections Research Center.

did.abstract: Prince William County newspapers dating from 1851 to 1992.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on personal use. Permission to publish material from the Prince William Historic Newspaper collection must be obtained from Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Prince William County Historic Newspapers collection, C301, Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by the Prince William County Library in November 2016.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing completed by Brittney Falter in February 2017. EAD markup completed by Brittney Falter in February 2017.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The "Manassas Journal" began under W.H.W. Moran & Co. in 1895. In 1945, the "Manassas Messenger" was created, and on November 22, 1951, the "Manassas Journal" and the "Manassas Messenger" merged to from the "Journal Messenger." The "Journal Messenger" existed until 1997 and leaned Democratic. The "Prince William News," published under Clarence W. Wagener, was a weekly paper from 1921 to 1923. "Potomac News" began in 1959 in Dumfries, VA and in 1979 moved to Woodbridge, VA until it ended in 2008.

The miscellaneous series contains a few issues from newspapers like the "Richmond News Leader" (circa 1896-1992), "Richmond Times-Dispatch" (circa 1903-1992), the "Fauquier Democrat" (1905-1989), and the "Alexandria Gazette" (1834-1974) among others. The "Richmond News Leader" and "Richmond Times-Dispatch" became the two main papers in Richmond in the early 20th century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Several newspapers from Prince William County and other Virginia papers such as the "Manassas Journal," "Manassas Messenger," "Potomac News," the "Prince William News," and the "Journal Messenger." SCRC also has a few issues from the "Alexandria Gazette," the "Richmond News Leader," "Richmond Times-Dispatch" and news clippings. The papers in this collection date roughly from 1861 to 1992.

list.item: Series 2: The Prince William News, 1921-1923 (Oversize Box 2)
